posts.title: Start Here: Low-Tox Living in 7 Simple Swaps
posts.excerpt: Seven quick, affordable changes that cut your exposure without turning life upside down.
posts.contentHtml:
Big results don’t need big budgets. These are our seven high-impact, low-effort swaps.

  1. Air: Open windows daily and use a small HEPA purifier in the bedroom.
  2. Water: Use a certified pitcher filter that targets PFAS, chlorine and heavy metals.
  3. Cookware: Prefer cast iron, stainless or ceramic over aging non-stick.
  4. Fragrance: Switch to fragrance-free laundry liquid and unscented cleaners.
  5. Plastics: Store hot foods in glass or stainless, not soft plastics.
  6. Dust: Vacuum with a HEPA vacuum weekly; dust with a damp cloth.
  7. Light: Dim lights after sunset and keep screens out of the bedroom.

posts.title: Sleep Better: 3 Habits That Actually Stick
posts.excerpt: A calmer evening routine, a darker room, and a consistent wake time—backed by boring science.
posts.contentHtml:
Good sleep is mostly about consistency. Try this for 14 nights:

  • Same wake time every day. Even weekends.
  • Dark + cool room. Blackout curtains and a light sleep mask help.
  • Wind-down hour. No work or intense screens in the last 60 minutes.

If you need a gentle mask, this silk option is comfortable and washable.
